title: Solomon's Preparations for the Temple
shortSummary: This chapter details the diplomatic and logistical preparations Solomon undertakes to build the temple of the Lord. It highlights Solomon's wisdom, his alliance with King Hiram of Tyre, and the mobilization of resources and labor necessary for this monumental task.
timeline: c. 970 BC - Early reign of Solomon

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel, son of David, who initiates the building of the temple as God had promised to his father.

keyCharacters.name: Hiram
keyCharacters.description: King of Tyre, a friend to David and Solomon, who provides cedar and fir timber and skilled workers for the temple construction.

keyCharacters.name: Adoniram
keyCharacters.description: Official appointed by Solomon to oversee the labor force conscripted for the building project.

definitions.definition: Highly valued timber from Lebanon, prized for its durability and fragrance, used extensively in ancient temple construction.
A conscripted labor force or tax in manpower, often used for large state projects like building or military service.
Inhabitants of the Phoenician city of Sidon, known for their skill in woodworking and maritime trade.
To cut or shape wood or stone with a tool, an essential skill for preparing building materials.

outline.heading: Hiram’s Offer of Assistance
outline.description: Hiram, king of Tyre, hears of Solomon’s accession and, recalling his friendship with David, offers to supply cedar and fir timber for the temple. Solomon requests this help, emphasizing God’s promise and his readiness to build now that there is peace.

outline.heading: Agreement and Exchange
outline.description: Hiram agrees to provide timber and transport it by sea, while Solomon promises to supply food for Hiram’s household. The chapter notes that the Lord grants Solomon wisdom and peace prevails between the two kings, leading to a strong alliance.

outline.heading: Mobilization of Labor
outline.description: Solomon conscripts a large workforce from Israel, including laborers and skilled hewers of stone and wood, organized under capable officers to carry out the temple construction.

outline.heading: Preparation of Materials
outline.description: The chapter concludes with the preparation of costly stones and timber by Solomon’s and Hiram’s builders, setting the foundation for the temple, demonstrating careful planning and cooperation.

application: Trust in God’s timing and promises, as Solomon waited for peace before building the temple, showing obedience and faith.
Value wise counsel and form godly partnerships, exemplified by Solomon’s alliance with Hiram to accomplish God’s work.
Commit to diligent preparation and organization when undertaking God’s assignments, reflecting the careful planning in this chapter.
Pray for wisdom from the Lord in all endeavors, as Solomon was granted wisdom to lead and build according to God’s will.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league together.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God’s faithfulness in granting Solomon wisdom and peace, enabling the temple project to proceed through divine blessing and human cooperation.

keyVerses.text: And, behold, I purpose to build an house unto the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spake unto David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build an house unto my name.
keyVerses.significance: Solomon declares his divine mandate to build the temple, fulfilling God’s promise to David and demonstrating obedience to God’s revealed plan.

keyVerses.text: Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and unto thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that can skill to hew timber like unto the Sidonians.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows Solomon’s recognition of the need for skilled labor and his willingness to compensate fairly, emphasizing the importance of expertise and cooperation in God’s work.
